byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt contributed reporting from Washington.

abstract: Russian government announces intelligence-sharing agreement with Iraq, Syria and Iran as part of its effort to combat Islamic State, surprising United States for second time in month with move intended to expand nation's influence in Syrian conflict; agreement is signal that Pres Vladimir V Putin is setting up coalition that may rival one formed by US to fight Islamic State, and could enable Russia to influence choice of successor should Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad decide to step down.
lead_paragraph: Russia left the United States scrambling by reaching an understanding with Iraq, Syria and Iran to share intelligence about the Islamic State militants.

headline.main: Russia Surprises U.S. With Accord on Battling ISIS
headline.print_headline: Russia Surprises U.S. With Accord on Battling ISIS

snippet: Russia left the United States scrambling by reaching an understanding with Iraq, Syria and Iran to share intelligence about the Islamic State militants.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
